cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 175 miles (280 km) south of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving generally north, expected to turn north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle, then sweep across Georgia and the Carolinas toward the western Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from Tulum to Cabo Catoche, Yucatán Peninsula (Mexico)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning for Pinar del Río Province and Isle of Youth (Cuba)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Mississippi to Florida, then inland across Georgia and the Carolinas to the Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≈11%) for tropical-storm-force winds; strongest winds would arrive late Wednesday or early Thursday if the core tracks close to the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Georgia coast with the current forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain 2–4 inches, locally higher, possible as the system moves across Georgia on 10–11 Oct.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls and isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out in outer rain-bands.
